variable.name: ANPP_0_OM
method.notes: ANPP_0_OM was calculated by adding tree biomass increment and litterfall during the period of measurement. Aboveground tree biomass was estimated allometrically using tree inventory data and biomass-diameter relation

variable.name: ANPP_0_OM
method.notes: ANPP_0_OM was calculated by adding tree biomass increment and litterfall during the period of measurement. Pine, mahogany, and roble (Tabebuia heterophylla (DC.) Britton) trees were harvested to supplement available biomass information on these species. Least squares regression analysis was used to develop bio- mass-diameter relation

variable.name: biomass_ag_OM
method.notes: Aboveground tree biomass was estimated allometrically using tree inventory data and biomass-diameter relation

variable.name: biomass_ag_OM
method.notes: Pine, mahogany, and roble (Tabebuia heterophylla (DC.) Britton) trees were harvested to supplement available biomass information on these species. Least squares regression analysis was used to develop biomass-diameter relation

variable.name: organic.layer_OM
method.notes: multiplying the concentration of organic matter at the center of each soil horizon in the 1 x 1 x 1 m pit by the thickness of the horizon and its bulk density

method.notes: See Filip et al. 1995. Loss of leaf mass to herbivores was determined from repeated measurements of damage on individually labeled leaves; percent leaf area also measured using discrete measurements over a 3-year period (1983-1985); For the long-term measurements, percent leaf area eaten measured by leaf tracing.

variable.name: ANPP_woody_stem_C
method.notes: Where the individual tree data (including taxonomy) are available, we use allometric equation (Baker et al. 2004) to directly estimate the above-ground biomass at every census.

variable.name: GPP
method.notes: GPP = NPPtotal + Ra = plant carbon expenditure PCE, Metcalfe et al. 2010

variable.name: ANPP_woody_branch_OM
method.notes: Harvest (branches > 2 cm diameter), larger branches measured diameter at 3 points, assigned wood density value

variable.name: ANPP_foliage_OM
method.notes: Litter traps, separated into components, oven dried and weighed

variable.name: ANPP_repro_OM
method.notes: Litter traps, separated into components, oven dried and weighed

variable.name: R_auto_C
method.notes: Ra = Rleaf + Rstem + Rrhizosphere + Rcoarse root

variable.name: R_auto_foliage_C
method.notes: Leaf gas exchange measurements of Rdark were performed using infra-red gas analysers

variable.name: R_auto_wood_C
method.notes: Bole respiration was measured using a closed dynamic chamber method with an IRGA (EGM-4) and soil respiration chamber (SRC-1) connected to a permanent collar, sealed to the tree bole surface

variable.name: R_soil_C
method.notes: closed dynamic chamber method with an infra-red gas analyser and soil respiration chamber

method.notes: Leaves collected in litterfall traps photographed before drying. Leaves scanned to calculate leaf area lost to herbivory. The fractional herbivory (H) for each leaf was calculated (see Table 3)

variable.name: ANPP_woody_stem_C
method.notes: Measured diameter of all stems in repeat censuses following CTFS-ForestGEO protocol, estimated biomass based on allometries, calculated woody productivity as summed changes in biomass of individual stems divided by census inverval

variable.name: biomass_ag_C
method.notes: Measured diameter of all stems following CTFS-ForestGEO protocol, estimated biomass based on allometries. Estimated C as 47% of biomass.

variable.name: delta.agb_C
method.notes: Measured diameter of all stems in repeat censuses following CTFS-ForestGEO protocol, estimated biomass based on allometries, calculated net biomass change as difference between the two censuses divided by census interval

variable.name: woody.mortality_ag_C
method.notes: Measured diameter of all stems following CTFS-ForestGEO protocol, estimated biomass based on allometries, calculated woody mortality as summed biomass of all stems that died divided by census interval

variable.name: biomass_ag_OM
method.notes: Measured dbh, total height, and crown base height for tree species > 1.5 cm dbh; measured total height and crown diameter for shrub species and tree species < 1.5 cm dbh; entered into allometric equations

variable.name: ANPP_0_OM
method.notes: ANPP_0_OM was calculated by combining litter (leaf+branch) and growth data (allometric relations based on height and diameter).

variable.name: LAI
method.notes: Yearly LAI was calculated by multiplying the average leaf area/mass value for each life form by the estimated leaf biomass in each life form and then summing over life forms.

variable.name: Reco
method.notes: Ecosystem respiration based on nighttime respiration vs soil or air temperature relationship

variable.name: GPP
method.notes: modeled based on continuous eddy flux measurements, with leaf photosynthesis described according to the model of Farquhar and von Caemmerer (1982)

variable.name: Reco
method.notes: modeled based on continuous eddy flux measurements and site-specific functions for respiratory components

variable.name: ANPP_0_OM
method.notes: ANPP_0_OM was estimated by summing annual litterfall accumulation (897 g/m2/year) plus biomass change due to delayed mortality (142 g/m2/year) plus estimated herbivory (25 g/m2/year)

variable.name: ANPP_folivory_OM
method.notes: Followed herbivory of tagged leaves over 3 mo., to 12 m ht. maximum, got 1% herbivory in 90 days, extrapolated to 4% over a year;converted to /ha with LAI values based on plumb bob data and standing leaf biomass from mass/area relation.
